message: Let's start with a fair split, and we can adjust in future rounds if needed.
You rejected my fair offer, so I'll try to negotiate from a stronger position. Let's meet in the middle this time.
You're trying to negotiate from a stronger position, but I'm willing to compromise. Let's try to find a better split than meeting in the middle.
You're compromising, but I'm still not getting the best deal. I'll try to push for a more favorable split this time.
You're pushing for a more favorable split, but I'm not willing to give up that much. I'll try to find a middle ground that works for both of us.
I'm not budging on my previous offer, but I'm willing to make a slight concession to get a deal done. Take it or leave it.
I understand you're not budging, but I'm willing to make a small concession to get closer to a deal. I'll try to find a compromise that works for both of us.
I'm not compromising further. I'll take 80% and leave you with 20%. That's my final offer. Take it or leave it.
I'm not accepting your final offer, and I'm willing to take a risk to get a better deal. I'll try to push for a more balanced split, even if it means going to the wire.
You're taking a risk, but I'm not backing down. I'll take 90% and leave you with 10%. This is my last offer, and I'm not budging.
I'm not giving up yet. I'll try to make one last push for a more balanced split. I'm willing to take a risk and hope that Bob will see the value in a more equitable division.
You've pushed me to the limit. I'll take all the money, and we'll call it a day. It's been a long negotiation, and I'm not willing to walk away with nothing.
